TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AggregationMode extends System.Enum

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.AggregationMode Default = int32(0)

summary.para: Aggregation mode: aggregate immediately after insert or update operation(s) are complete.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.AggregationMode Disabled = int32(3)

summary.para: Aggregation mode: never aggregate this raw contact. The raw contact will not have a corresponding aggregate and therefore will not be included in query results.
For example, this mode can be used for a raw contact that is marked for deletion while waiting for the deletion to occur on the server side.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.AggregationMode Immediate = int32(1)

summary.para: Aggregation mode: aggregate at the time the raw contact is inserted/updated.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.AggregationMode Suspended = int32(2)

summary.para: Aggregation mode: aggregation suspended temporarily, and is likely to be resumed later. Changes to the raw contact will update the associated aggregate contact but will not result in any change in how the contact is aggregated. Similar to , but maintains a link to the corresponding aggregate.
This can be used to postpone aggregation until after a series of updates, for better performance and/or user experience.
Note that changing from to does not trigger an aggregation pass, but any subsequent change to the raw contact's data will.
